intro: Helianthopsis hypargyrea, commonly known as the silverleaf helianthopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically hairy foliage. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky soils and arid environments, making it well adapted to desert conditions. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
